content: Context rot describes the phenomenon where LLMs' reasoning collapses on long-form narratives due to standard RAG systems feeding them fragmented 'bag of chunks' rather than coherent context.

The Generative Semantic Workspace (GSW) is a neuro-inspired framework that enables AI to construct a persistent, episodic memory by moving beyond mere fact retrieval to build a dynamic internal world model.

The GSW architecture utilizes an Operator to witness events and a Reconciler to weave these events into a coherent spatiotemporal timeline, allowing the model to track evolving actor states and relationships.
The Generative Semantic Workspace (GSW) architecture can generate concise narrative summaries from its own structured memory.
The state-of-the-art performance of the Generative Semantic Workspace (GSW) on episodic benchmarks suggests that it represents the future of long-context reasoning in AI.
